snippet: Jürgen Todenhöfer, a critic of conflict, defended his interview with Syria’s leader and spoke of his motivation to hear what his subject had to say.
abstract: Jurgen Todenhofer, German writer and outspoken antiwar advocate whose interview with Syria's Pres Bashar al-Assad was heavily criticized as a propaganda platform, defends their talk, saying he wanted to give Assad an opportunity to explain himself.

byline.contributor: Victor Homola contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Jürgen Todenhöfer, a critic of conflict, defended his interview with Syria’s leader and spoke of his motivation to hear what his subject had to say.
